form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Burr (for himself, Mr. Johanns, Mr. Rubio, Mr. Isakson, and Mr. Boozman) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to ensure that memorials commemorating the service of the United States Armed Forces may contain religious symbols, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the War Memorial Protection Act of 2013.

section.header: Inclusion of religious symbols as part of military memorials

subsection.text: Chapter 21 of title 36, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Inclusion of religious symbols as part of military memorials

subsection.text: To recognize the religious background of members of the United States Armed Forces, religious symbols may be included as part ofâ€”

paragraph.text: a military memorial that is not established by the United States Government, but for which the American Battle Monuments Commission cooperated in the establishment of the memorial.

subsection.text: In this section, the term military memorial means a memorial or monument commemorating the service of the United States Armed Forces. The term includes works of architecture and art described in section 2105(b) of this title.
The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 2115. Inclusion of religious symbols as part of military memorials.
